page.title: 06Crosskeys College
page.content: In 1913 local coalowners started a school of mines at Crumlin, north of Crosskeys. In 1929 Monmouthshire L.E.A. took responsibility for the school, and it became the "Technical College of Monmouthshire", moving to its present site in 1961. In 1976 the College "went tertiary", becoming the sole centre for post_16 academic/ vocational education for students leaving the six local 11_16 comprehensive schools. In 1982 the name "Crosskeys College" was adopted. The name changes reflect the decline of mining in the area. The College enrols 1200 full_time and a similar number of part_time students each year, about 50% coming from outside the College's catchment area. This reflects the "open_access" philosophy of tertiary education. The present Principal is Dr. W. Bleazard.{
